newsitem.title: USA: DII sees 1997 EPS range $2.50 to $2.75.
newsitem.headline: DII sees 1997 EPS range $2.50 to $2.75.

text.p: Electronic manufacturing goods maker DII Group on Tuesday said it expected 1997 fully diluted earnings per share would be between $2.50 and $2.75 a share, a narrower range than analysts have forecast.
First Call's 1997 consensus figure was $2.83. The range of forecasts was not available.

DII, which earlier reported third quarter earnings per share of $0.38 before merger costs, down from $0.45 a year ago, said softness in businesses outside contract electronics manufacturing was more severe than expected.

"We currently expect fourth quarter earnings to be only slightly better than the third quarter," said chief financial officer Carl Vertuca. He added that the order outlook was, nevertheless, encouraging.

After charges, DII's net per share in the third quarter was $0.12, which missed First Call's consensus of $0.29. This was partly because the costs of the merger with Orbit Semiconductor came in at $0.26 per share instead of $0.19 as expected by analysts. -- New York Newsroom 212 859 1610
